author: s1na
content:
Hey all, regarding EIP-4844, right now in the spec there are `blobVersionedHashes`, `maxFeePerBlobGas` and `blobs` in GenericTransaction. I propose we remove `blobs` and proceed only with the hashes as per the discussion here. I have a PR to that effect in geth (https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/28786). This means concretely the following changes to the API:
- `eth_sendTransaction` will fail if it notices a blob-related field. I.e. this will not be supported.
- Sending EIP-4844 transactions will be only possible via `eth_sendRawTransaction`
- `eth_signTransaction` can sign a blob-tx (actually I'm hesitant about this one)
- `eth_call` can simulate a tx with blob hashes
- `eth_estimateGas` blobs have no effect here
- `eth_fillTransaction`, this method is not even specced. In my PR it can fill in `maxFeePerBlobGas` if user provided blob hashes

author: sky.cactus
content: I recommend not adding blob transaction support to `eth_signTransaction` and instead we put it in the `wallet_signTransaction` namespace.  Same with `eth_sendTransaction`.  By not supporting blobs in those methods, it gives a bit of incentive for people to migrate to the `wallet_` namespace which is not managed/specced by the core devs.

author: sky.cactus
content: I feel like `eth_fillTransaction` should also move to the `wallet_` namespace, but maybe there are things that a node is needed to properly fill it in?

author: s1na
content: I think that makes sense. I'd even bootstrap the `wallet_` namespace in the same repo until it gathers momentum.

author: s1na
content: IMO the client is well-positioned to serve `eth_fillTransation`. Mostly because of the fee fields and gas estimation. Nonce and chainID can be optionally provided by the wallet.
